D78hO7xD6-rQaSXyjVpGGg.text: Wonderful place, great food and great service. Highly recommend to anyone. We stumbled upon while walking around.

uVtzNLexH2Ke7xMDNR8_BA.text: Visited salt 'n' pepper for the first time on the 30th December. I was on a first date with a beautiful woman who adores indian/Pakistani food, so I was keen to impress. Given the raving reviews on yelp, this seemed a sure choice and didn't fall short of my expectation. The decor inside is warm and inviting, and customer service was second to none. The food was served hot and within an excellent time frame, was delicious, fresh and excellent value for money. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area looking for something a little set back from the hustle and bustle of Leicester Square, who has a taste for contemporary Pakistani cuisine yet without having to bust the bank! My date was extremely impressed with my choice, who has agreed to see me again. Thanks to salt 'n' pepper for making it an evening to be remembered, and to yelp for providing this service. Thank you

nKFpc8DbB1QwJupsGqMPkQ.text: I stayed at the hotel adjacent to the restaurant in September and stopped by for a quick meal before the theater. I was seated at a lovely outdoor table and ordered an appetizer and a dinner entree as well as 2 glasses of red wine. Everything I had was delicious! The service was wonderful and the manager, Mr. Sharma stopped by my table and we had a very nice chat. I will definitely be back again next time I'm visiting as both the Royal Trafalgar and Salt 'n Pepper were winners.

M2QXs6Btkh8N_7aa43gpDA.text: I came here for dinner last night after a comedy show. We were looking for restaurants in the Covent garden/Leicester square area with an offer on, which seemed like an unlikely task. However, this place was on tablepouncer and opentable with a 50% offer which is pretty damn good for central (we booked with opentable because tablepouncer charges a £5 booking fee for the same offer - just as an FYI). We booked for 8.45 and there was only one other party in there. We were told that for the 50% off you had to order a starter and a main each, but that suited us down to the ground. We ordered the amb somosas and the shami kebabs for starter and chicken tikka masala and korma for mains. I found all of it very spicy, especially the starters and the masala. I thought I'd be safe with a korma as they're meant for wimps right? But this one was still pretty spicy. We also got 2x rice and a naan with a beer and a coke and the whole thing came to £38 which is a steal (it would have been £65).The staff were okay but our waiter had the voice of a mouse and seemed to whisper everything. I see why they run this offer, because the restaurant is on a back street off Leicester square so you would only find it if you know about it. However, I would recommend giving it a go, only if you have the offer.

yPqLLLqUEaRWI0PDnKlU8Q.text: Great traditional #Indian & #Pakistanese food with a touch of modernism added to it!Service is also very good.Awesome experience right next to Leicester Square!

ZobNEJRbmlUlUeHJcZn-qg.text: Food was very good and the servers were very considerate and welcoming. The atmosphere was also very family friendly

M-dsGSpRnzeNqcCr6IboyA.text: Waiter didn't ask what we would drink. Waiter walked away while I was ordering. Never checked on us to see how we were doing but checked in on others many times. Food wasn't great. It was also fairly expensive.

7wbNowlVujYX5pFgdup1Rw.text: We were craving Indian food and found the restaurant via yelp. We ordered the butter chicken curry, lamb curry, the lamb chops & vegetable pakora. Everything was so delicious & great flavor! The lamb chops & vegetable pakora were some of the best we've ever had. Definitely a great place to eat!

u-V3hsAT2lZlpSn0_FBxZg.text: We cam across this place online after looking for a thai or indian restaurent last night.We made a reservation online that even cam with half off for startes and mains, saving us 31.95(!)Staff was friendly and took the time to help us decide what to order as we had never eaten at a Pakistani restaurent. We ordered 3 starters and 3 mains for the 3 of us and it was just about the right amount.The restaurant was at the end of Orange Street which is under construction so if you take a cab, he may not know where you want to go, or think there is a restaurant there.Good lighting, unpretentious and casual atmosphere.Definitely recommended.

IPeT08qaC4xdftUnHWR9qA.text: Decent value for fairly good food. Panir app was a little too dry but nicely crispy and it perked up with yogurt-mint sauce.  Prawns app was pleasantly spicy in a tomato sauce. Dal Makhani was rich and tasty though on par with other average places for this dish. Ordered lamb chops but unfortunately got lamb shish kebab instead.  This was disappointing because we wanted meaty pieces, not lamb-burger.  The kebabs were overly spiced to the point of obliterating the lamb flavor. I didn't complain as our time was short.  Bottle of house red wine was fair - nothing special but ok for price. Decor was simple and sparse.  Bottom line: decent enough place for a pre-theater meal but definitely not a destination restaurant. Not worth a second visit.

3YKV1eralyrKQqoWOTJMDA.text: Went for a few different dishes and wasn't disappointed by any of them.  The absolute highlight was the Saag & Methi chicken. Just the right amount of heat along with very juicy chicken. It went really well with both the rice and the naan I ordered to accompany it. The tikka was also very tasty with the flavour of the yoghurt still discernible and not dry at all.  For the starters I can recommend both the Papri Chaat and the vegetable samosas as I enjoyed each of them as much as the other. All round a great meal and I can't wait to go back to try some more!

dBWTJOJg2AvGEji0Pqz-oQ.text: Salt N Pepper is hands down the best Indian and Pakistani Food I have ever had. The staff treated me and my friends visiting from out of the country like family. I went twice on my recent visit to London, and both visits were stellar. Out of the seven dishes we tried, they were all incredibly delicious. The tikka masala was amazing, the naan was on point, and every vegetable dish we had was perfection.

sjaWOy_IjpJ0ym4NZm2zBw.text: Absurdly good.  Best Samosa, best Naan, best Tikka Masala I've ever had. Sitting here sweating after the meal... And loving it!

UmDGdHdg4BxHmGE9Ve7QLQ.text: Dropped by for an early dinner after a visit to the National Gallery. The food was great. My friend and I had poppadoms and chutney to start which were really good. We ordered a whole bunch of starters to share and we actually ordered too much (4 starters and a peshwari naan). Highly recommend the chilli prawns

P4rzANrO4Ogkfa-w_GPBSA.text: We came to this place by recommendation of some locals. There were so many strikes against this meal that under any other circumstances, it would have been a disaster. For example, I love Southern Indian cuisine but this place is Northern Indian/Pakistani. Though I've never had Pakistani food before this, Northern Indian has failed to impress me in the past. I also don't eat meat and their menu is mainly meat dishes. When I did eat meat, chicken was my least favorite and we ordered chicken for my son. Lastly, I've never been a fan of Daal... read on...By the time I realized this place is Pakistani/Northern Indian it was too late, we had already ordered drinks and appetizers. I also had a huge lunch and wasn't hungry but was forced to come to dinner as my wife was starving. So I was now prepared for a disappointing meal. As we were waiting for our food, the staff was extremely friendly and came to play with my son (even taking him for a walk around the restaurant in the beginning). Our waiter was very knowledgable and recommended individual courses that worked together to create a well rounded meal. When the food arrived, I braced myself and took a bite of the Paneer Tika Masala. It was like butter. The flavor was heavenly and I couldn't wait to try the next dish, the Prawn Karahi. It was perfection. The flavor was multi dimensioned... it was, as my wife would describe as "a party in your mouth!"As mentioned earlier, Daal isn't my favorite but Taji wanted to try it anyway. But the Daal Channa here was the best I've ever had. The biggest surprise of the night was the Tandoori Chicken which we ordered for my son. My wife raved about it and asked me to take a bite. As mentioned earlier, I don't eat meat and when I did, my least favorite was chicken. But one bite led to another, and soon I ate the entire piece. Each bite was filled with flavor completely through the chicken. Simply delicious.  We also ordered Onion and Garlic Naan as well as Chili and Coriander Naan, both were outstanding. I began this meal with so many strikes against it and left beyond impressed. This has been the best meal we've had so far on this trip and ranks as one of our all time favorite meals. We will but putting Salt and Pepper on our list of must eat places whenever we return to London.

7mPjb-9jH-X1jjm-rXriDQ.text: This is the best Pakistani food I have eaten while in London.  I would actually say that it is the top meal of this trip.  Tucked in a back corner behind Leicester Square, this unassuming restaurant features traditional fair.  I highly recommend the Chicken Tikka and their spicy lamb dish.

CMmsvCy1agAP8_X0gwp-PA.text: Great food, no complains there. I love their barbeque kebabs.They are a little cheeky when it comes to service charge, they just added it without notifying us.No complains about the food. Must try their chicken cheese burger, it's absolutely delicious

OnrsOSwR05aTJ_Dej6Mimg.text: We liked it so much we ate there twice on our 6 day trip to London from the US.  Each dish was well presented, very flavorful, and properly prepared.  Meats were tender, sauces were tasty without being overdone, and the breads were fluffy and yummy.  We had a total of greater than 6 different dishes and loved them all.  We frequent Indian restaurants in the US and I recommend a visit next time you are near Trafalgar Square or Piccadilly Circus.  Truly worth it.

qWl3cCql2h06u25UJBXE2A.text: Get yourself here and order the Saag & Methi chicken, succulent chunks of chicken cooked to perfection with spices, spinach & yoghurt sauce - delicious. Fresh naan bread still steaming in the basket and crispy poppadum's to boot. This place is a hidden gem and so close to the hype and overpricing of Leicester square. Service was friendly and prompt - I will be back - so nice to find decent food in an area so flooded with fast food.

M_LE6vYmcsUcBAe7jaJ1KQ.text: Had chicken butter Masala....medium heat ..but was not that hot. But you just never know until you eat at place few times.  Tasty. Good naan. Nice little place with friendly service. First time I had Indian food with bones and all...wasn't lots of meat but some wasn't cooked (raw) so they made me another and didn't charge me. Great customer service.

9Dc2KflBlWqgk-sOcvjIeA.text: This is an excellent resturant tucked away a block from Leicester square. Very well prepared mains, the decor is pleasant and new and the staff were very friendly.  Did I say the food was excellent!  I would come back again.

ShjhfQLgN3-B0JeJ-ypr-g.text: Decent quality food but nothing exceptional. We also ordered the doodh Patti chai which was very poor

ieObJ-B9UXQsoRwIcYdc1A.text: Very nice service and pleasant space.  This is the first time I've had Kingfisher on tap so that was nice too.  The potato samosas were tasty and hot...the chicken jalfrezi was also very good but not especially spicy even though it was listed on the menu with the "two peppers" symbol.  All in all a very good place for lunch.

XfsteRnTQoTOUCsDKXa9nw.text: I tried the curry&lamb and I really love it！It's near the National Gallery and many theaters. It's a good choice for dinner and then watch a play

photos.caption: Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom

Lwdolg0Wj2l4uok7xTF1xA.text: We regret going there. Serving Time was an hour, even though the restaurant was empty. Naan served were not fully cooked, we had to request to get new naan as we couldn't eat. I almost feel like the chef for the naan was out that day, because they had no idea what they were doing with the naans. Curries were okay. It was PRICEY due to it being the center of London, will not recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom

HnSAuAsnIARjk3rcwXgbXQ.text: Pretty good but wasn't what I was expecting.  The curry I had was like creamy sweet soup.  My friend has another curry that was actually really good.  Undecided if I'll be back.  Maybe just ordered the wrong thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom

27kZMIlt7Vv7TsrgWTQcGw.text: Came here for our first curry meal with the school trip. Who decided to do this?!? Meal was small buffet and ventured on the bland side. No spice whatsoever.  If this Indian food representative of Londons finest where is the taste? Server came around to each table and offered soda for 1 pound normally 2.5.  Good deal. We had the Luke warm water, not offered twice. Mango chutney not mango chutney, more like a mango salad dressing again no spice. White basmati rice was not seasoned. Plain. Burnt pita bread and no flavoring. Right off Leicester Square, so rent is not cheap. This had to be a bad decision to have such a bland meal served to newbies. Some taste is better than no taste. If I lived here, I would try lunch. Sadly so disappointed. It is bright and airy and probably would try again .

RJs2utkwPl9wgyyP_JvA9w.text: First meal in London and it did not disappoint. This casual restaurant is bright and clean offering hospitable service. The lamb and chicken dishes were extremely tender and while the seasoning was mild, it was enough to satisfy. The naan was fresh but I didn't like that the dough was not crisp at the edges and had no air pockets which make a gorgeous and delicious piece of flat bread. What was ordered:Malai Chicken Boti (appetizer)Boneless chicken breast marinated in cardamom, cream and green chillies. - So tender and delicious Grilled Lamb Chops (appetizer)Lamp chops, chargrilled to perfection and served with mint chutney. - Very tender and flavorfulGrilled boneless chicken tikka simmered in a mild creamy tomato sauce. (entree) - Delicious but the spices were very mild Onion and garlic Naan - Flavorful but didn't have the air pockets I was hoping forCheddar Cheese Naan - Strong in cheese flavor and probably better paired with a spinach dishA light dinner for two:Two appetizers,  one entree, two orders of naan, and two drinks for  dinner will set you back  about 45 GBP ($65)What you need to know:- Book via Opentable for special discounts. Right now there's 1/2 off starters and entrees. I missed out by one day - Open late - Easy to find

photos.caption: Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom. Street and sign
Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom. Entrance
Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom. Cheese naan

IJR0-Ym5wMrB5gcCe8dCvQ.text: Ok... my favorite food is now Indian food. Indian food made from  this Pakistani family at this restaurant. WOW! That's enough said... spicy deliciousness that made my 10 year old ask for more and more. As long as your in England who says English don't have good food?! Well, as long as it's not "English" food ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom. Mango and ice cream. Yumm!
Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom. Mango rice pudding, not as thick as I've had but very flavorful.
Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom

9sj7___h00bnC2ul1TitjQ.text: This place is amazing! Me and a couple friends were craving curry pretty late at night and came across Salt 'n Pepper. The food was amazing and the service was both efficient and friendly. Probably one of my favorite Indian dishes I've had in a long time.

7TWTqaLiN8IlGOifG2u21w.text: Am I not eating Indian food correctly in London? This is only my second foray into Indian food in London, and I was left somewhat disappointed again.There is an interesting plaque on the wall that said something like, we only use British produce, organic foods (or something like that), but curiously the last line said "We use fewer spices, in fewer quantities" - but why? Indian food is the king when it comes to using a variety of spices, and I think that what makes it quite good. I don't want my Indian food to be bland!I thought the potato samosa tasted a bit flat and dry. The korma chicken was the biggest disappointment. Usually in the States korma is like orange or brown. This one was almost a nude color, which is really odd for Indian food. The sauce was not that flavorful. The spinach dishes we got were okay. They sadly did not have palak paneer, so we got something close but it was not quite right. My friend said the paneer didn't taste that great. I thought the spinach portion itself was decent. One of the spinach dishes was unusually spicy, so spicy that I started crying.The mango lassi was very delicious though.It could be that I'm just ignorant when it comes to British Indian food, but I thought this place was just okay. They could up the flavors a bit more here.

osB12uon_50XGFJMBx71UQ.text: I wandered in here randomly on a wet winter night after visiting Leicester Square while in town for business.  I was trying to eat as many different nationality foods as possible when the word "Pakistani" drew me in.  Now, I'll be honest, I probably couldn't tell Indian from Kashmiri from Pakistani food, but I do know good food, and they served it up well here.  Got a curry and another Pakistani (darn, can't recall what) chicken dish.  Both were amazing.  Carried out as it was a wet night and ate back at the hotel.  Everything was still hot and fresh 20 minutes later the way they had it packed up.  Friendly staff took care of me while I waited and sent me off with everything I needed to feast back in my room.  Thank you!

b31hOOL51-kaxVOvEXLiyw.text: Food is good it's just the quantity that is not satisfactory! So , it is 3and a half ! A little too less for the price .

AD3WTu7DNjfy9XDoUZbL3g.text: Went after buying 4 for £16 cocktail deal through timeout expecting it to be a cocktail barIt's actually a rather badly decorated Indian restaurant However staff were friendly and we were seated straight awayThere was a theatre menu and as we were going to see made in Dagenham they allowed us to do that!So we ended up paying £10 for a starter and main each and shared them allStarters were a bit weird; we went for paneer tikka and a poppadum salad which were both nice but nothing amazing Then saag gosht and chicken tikka masala which were both really good!Cocktails were average! Very sweet tasting and not what I expected because of the time out offerOverall an odd experience. Food was good though so I would go again if I fancied a curry and couldn't get in to dishoom!

photos.caption: Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom

UtA62-5GJU_m3OIw_YwzdQ.text: Lahore comes to London! We finally get to have some of the excellent Pakistani food you can usually only find by going to Pakistan. I am a bit of a snob about Pakistani food and have a hard time finding Pakistani/Indian food in London that I think is worth paying for. I know someone who is a fan of the Salt n' Pepper branch in Lahore and pointed me to the London location and I am so glad they did! The lamb seekh kabobs were piping hot and very good and the chappli kabobs were great. I really enjoyed the  tasty spices and flavouring of the karahi chicken, and I was very happy to wipe up every last bit of sauce with the excellent roghni naan. I have tried the saag aloo and the zeera aloo, both of which were nice although not as exciting as the karahi chicken. I think the saag aloo wins over the zeera aloo because of the edge the fenugreek gave it.The service here is very helpful and quick and the restaurant itself is spacious and clean. The food is not too cheap and the portions are not large, but considering this is Leicester Square, I think it is decent value. I am definitely coming back here as the menu has so much more I'd like to try and I want to see what the talented chef does with it!

photos.caption: Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom. Potatoes with saag
Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom. Chicken karahi

E55vRZshg3CfnH8UeewAfA.text: My husband and I love going to Tayyabs but figured we should try somewhere new for a change and this sounded quite comparable - also with an opentable deal - 50% off when you order a starter and a main.  It was a bit of a gamble taking a friend in town when we haven't tried the place ourselves but thought it was a really good centrally located place and of course - good Yelp reviews! At the moment, it's in the middle of all the construction around Leicester Square - which now seems like a really quiet street.We ordered the lamb samosas, lamb chops and lamb seehk kebabes as starters - all which came out amazing.  Comparing it to Tayyabs - pretty good!  Actually prefer some of the dishes here.  Felt a lot more fresh with more herbs and spices.For our mains, we had the chicken tikka, lamb rogan josh, and the chicken biryani along with an sorted bread basket.  When all of the food came out, at first I thought the portions looked quite small but we were so stuffed we asked to take what was left to go.  So happy to find this place - will definitely be back!

MVj-UtQEkdzPBy6ugophRg.text: Very solid Indian/Pakistani food in London. For sure stick to the knitting here and do not venture off menu to anything not originating from the subcontinent. First the naan. I thought it was only mediocre.  They had a neat selection of beers which I liked. One drawback was the smoking on the front patio it was epic and the stink was terrible. Why do people want to kill themselves with this poison?But the chicken do pyaza and the chicken Karachi now they are both on point and really tasty. I'd eat either one of them all day. This is where the restaurant earns its money and they got the most crucial thing right. Service not great though the waitress did a good job keeping up though she was overworked. This ain't Tayyabs but is still serviceable. I'd go back for sure.

o0WVpq7KYdK1N8QcC7EkhA.text: A bit hard to find at first and major construction going on across street but food is worth it.  Reasonable prices too.

nSYURP7oVxntXCf1eI06CA.text: Pros:  The bathroom was clean so you can assume the kitchen is clean.  :-) The staff was pleasant.Cons: The food was only ok. The curry lacked flavour. The samosas were warm on the outside and frigid on the inside.  If you go,  don't sit outside. Outside is very noisy with the current construction. Hmmm....overall,  a disappointing lunch experience.

On0LsY1zSbeKcsNawiSt3Q.text: Great find near Leicester Square! Every dish was spot on. Loved the Chicken Karahi, which was recommended after I asked for something spicy. The Dal Makhani was creamy and complex. Service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Karahi

0v7Nc_1ucaqak42Oc0eq7g.text: Good stuff! I kept it simple with tandoori chicken, samosas and allo gobi, but honestly I've had better in the UK. On the pricey side but not far from Piccadilly sq.

photos.caption: Photo of Salt 'n Pepper - London, United Kingdom. Bar

Ch9673MNxtiTkPNZzf0cDA.text: Excellent choice for Indian food! The staff were very welcoming and the chef also made the food spicy for us and mild for the kids. The chili prawns were awesome! Chicken tikka masala and the chutnuys are a must try.

lbI1-UbcTKSKlCGgboyp_Q.text: This was one of our first meals in London and we were not disappointed. The place is clean and fresh looking bc of the construction at Leister Sq it was difficult to find. We ordered the papri chaat and chicken tikka masala both were really good!!!! Def recommend that you try it for some authentic food!! The naan could be better... :) but overall great food!
